dtliExcerpt: The revival of A.R. Gurney's epistolary two-hander proves that sometimes the simplest theatrical conceits can be the most affecting.
bwwExcerpt: Glimmers of eloquence and much heart remain, though, and they're well served under Gregory Mosher's elegant, affectionate direction. Farrow, still luminous at 69, can be devastatingly coquettish and hilariously self-important as Melissa the girl...but is just as committed to capturing the aging woma...
